1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Explore the wonders of turtles, stalk some apex predators, meet some teen scientists, and find out how to cure Australia's biggest killer disease.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Delve into the underwater world of coral, search for ET and step into the future with the help of cotton.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: The spotlight shines on dental health in pregnant women. We ponder an Australian icon, get a bit queasy in tall buildings, and get to meet some baby turtles.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: See how scientists are using video games to teach kids about history, look into artificial tears, and for the love of science Tilly lets people pole things into her eyes.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Meet Tilly's favourite python, look at cities of the future and discover how climate change could affect your health. We also eavesdrop on the nerves of a 3rd year medical student.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Peer into neighbouring galaxies, fall in love with water and meet some design students thinking outside the box.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Meet an almost-human, slightly sarcastic robot, explore the mental health crisis in Australia and Tilly gets taken over by snakes.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Look into reasons why houses burn so quickly in bushfires, Tilly gets close to some very powerful magnets, and get into giant test tubes at the University of Western Sydney.

imdb.plot outline: Science Spectrum explores the world of science and innovation, uncovering some of the latest research taking place at the University of Western Sydney (UWS) from the wild outdoors to new climate change research. Hosted by science aficionado Tilly Boleyn, the show takes you on an interesting journey from baby turtles and wild dingoes to eavesdropping on nerves and beautiful fluorescent corals. Join Tilly as she goes on a journey of science discovery and shares all that she learns with you.
imdb.title: Science Spectrum
plot: All the latest science news from the University of Western Sydney. Hosted by Tilly Boleyn.

_Science Spectrum_ (qv) explores the world of science and innovation, uncovering some of the latest research taking place at the University of Western Sydney (UWS) from the wild outdoors to new climate change research. Hosted by science aficionado Tilly Boleyn, the show takes you on an interesting journey from baby turtles and wild dingoes to eavesdropping on nerves and beautiful fluorescent corals. Join Tilly as she goes on a journey of science discovery and shares all that she learns with you.
